---
<!-- Do not edit this file. It is generated automatically -->

## range() function

Returns Iterable/AsyncIterable of numbers (positive and/or negative) progressing from start-up to, but not including, end. it's set to start with a start then set to 0.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function range(length: number): IterableIterator<number>;
```



## Example


```ts
const iter = range(4);
iter.next() // {done:false, value: 0}
iter.next() // {done:false, value: 1}
iter.next() // {done:false, value: 2}
iter.next() // {done:false, value: 3}
iter.next() // {done:true, value: undefined}

// with pipe
pipe(
 range(4),
 toArray,
); // [0, 1, 2, 3]

pipe(
 range(1, 4),
 toArray,
); // [1, 2, 3]

// with toAsync
await pipe(
 range(4),
 toAsync,
 toArray,
); // [0, 1, 2, 3]
```
[Try It](https://codesandbox.io/s/fxts-range-3phyd)

see [pipe](https://fxts.dev/docs/pipe)<!-- -->, [toAsync](https://fxts.dev/docs/toAsync)<!-- -->, [toArray](https://fxts.dev/docs/toArray)


[Open Source Code](https://github.com/marpple/FxTS/blob/main/src/Lazy/range.ts)
